messages.message:
@Heymian @shaunak - travis was again out of builds just now `Builds have been temporarily disabled for private repositories due to a negative credit balance. Please go to the Plan page to replenish your credit balance.`

I have purchased an add-on, but not sure why it would happen again as i added one few days back. Who would be the best person to look at our travis subscription ?
@sudeep I don’t think I have the admin privileges on Travis.

got it, does this link work for you https://travis-ci.com/account/plan
i am not sure how do we add admins in travis
Yes, I can see that link; interesting :slightly_smiling_face:
I see that we have tests that are currently running
yep i just purchased some additional builds to get it going
had also purchased credits on Thursday, so will be great to check if we are on right plan ..
oh ok
We should check with Zach to see who is managing the plan right now
got it! was not sure who is managing the travis subscription

It looks like the error that I’m seeing is:
```The job exceeded the maximum time limit for jobs, and has been terminated.
625```

Also, all current tests (running on instabase:master) timeout with following error: `The job exceeded the maximum time limit for jobs, and has been terminated.` should we increase time limit of job from 50 minutes to higher limit?
Yes, we can
however, we need to find out why it is taking 50 mins to run the tests
:slightly_smiling_face:
these tests should be very fast
most time is taken due to pulling of jenkins docker image…
interesting — Jenkins image should be cached

as per the logs :
```Unable to find image 'gcr.io/instabase-build/jenkins:20.11.10.04.59.56 (http://gcr.io/instabase-build/jenkins:20.11.10.04.59.56)' locally
20.11.10.04.59.56: Pulling from instabase-build/jenkins```
Interesting — any idea how long does it actually take to pull the image?
My guess would be not more than 10 mins
that still leaves 40 mins of unexplained time
i don’t have actual idea, but it takes quite long, we can retrigger the build to check actual time…
it would be nice to have the idea
should i restart the build?
So one of the builds I checked at 15 mins was already [assed the mark
may be we should also print the time it takes to run the test?
yeah… we should do that!!
it takes ~6 minutes for jenkins image to be downloaded… ~1 minute before that (to clone instabase, install gcloud and other dependencies) after the tests are started…
